subject: Ethics
title: Employee Surveillance Ethics
description: A quick win: understand Employee Surveillance Ethics.

hook.text: Your employer tracks your keystrokes, screenshots your screen every 10 minutes, and monitors your bathroom breaks.

buildup.text: Remote work triggered a surveillance boom. 'Bossware' software monitors everything employees do on company devices.

discovery.text: Companies claim surveillance boosts productivity. Studies show it actually increases stress and decreases trust.

twist.text: In most US states, employers can legally monitor almost everything without telling employees. Consent isn't required.

climax.text: The EU takes a different approachâ€”GDPR requires proportionality and transparency in any workplace monitoring.

punchline.text: Watching people work doesn't make them work better. It makes them leave.

quiz.question: What do studies show about the effect of employee surveillance on productivity?
options: It significantly increases both productivity and morale
It increases stress and decreases trust without boosting real output
It has no measurable effect on workplace behavior
